newsitem.title: UK: Norway aid airfreighted to North Korea.
newsitem.headline: Norway aid airfreighted to North Korea.

text.p: UK-based air cargo management company AirRep said it organised an Ilyushin IL-76 freighter flight on Thursday from Oslo to Pyongyang, North Korea, carrying 42 tonnes of protein foodstuffs.
It said the flight was operated by one of its management airline clients, Latvian cargo carrier Inversia, on behalf of the Norwegian Red Cross.
"This is the third aid flight we have undertaken for from Oslo to Pyongyang over recent weeks," AirRep managing director Colin Martin told Reuters.

The other two were on behalf of UNESCO (the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation) and Martin said he had been told that further IL-76 flights from Norway to North Korea will be booked by UNESCO over the next few weeks. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
